title: Over 40,000 admin portal accounts use 'admin' as a password
description: Security researchers found that IT administrators are using tens of thousands of weak passwords to protect access to portals, leaving the door open to cyberattacks on enterprise networks. [...]

title: KwikTrip all but says IT outage was caused by a cyberattack
description: Kwik Trip has released another statement on an ongoing outage, all but confirming it suffered a cyberattack that has led to IT system disruptions. [...]

title: Malicious Notepad++ Google ads evade detection for months
description: A new Google Search malvertizing campaign targets users looking to download the popular Notepad++ text editor, employing advanced techniques to evade detection and analysis. [...]

title: Amazon adds passkey support as new passwordless login option
description: Amazon has quietly added passkey support as a new passwordless login option for customers, offering better protection from information-stealing malware and phishing attacks. [...]

title: D-Link confirms data breach after employee phishing attack
description: Taiwanese networking equipment manufacturer D-Link confirmed a data breach linked to information stolen from its network and put up for sale on BreachForums earlier this month. [...]

title: SpyNote Android malware spreads via fake volcano eruption alerts
description: Android malware 'SpyNote' was seen in an Italy-focused campaign that uses a phony 'IT-alert' public alert service website to infect visitors. [...]

title: Microsoft fixes known issue causing Outlook freezes, slow starts
description: Microsoft has fixed a known issue affecting Outlook for Microsoft 365 users since June and causing slow starts and freezes as if Offline Outlook Data Files (OST) were syncing right after launch. [...]

title: Fighting off cyberattacks? Make sure user credentials aren’t compromised
description: Login credential theft presents one of the biggest and most enduring cybersecurity problems. This article by Specops SOftware looks at the motivations driving credential theft and the tactics bad actors are likely to use. [...]

title: Over 10,000 Cisco devices hacked in IOS XE zero-day attacks
description: Attackers have exploited a recently disclosed critical zero-day bug to compromise and infect more than 10,000 Cisco IOS XE devices with malicious implants. [...]

title: Thousands of Cisco IOS XE devices hacked in widespread attacks
description: Attackers have exploited a recently disclosed critical zero-day bug to compromise and infect thousands of Cisco IOS XE devices with malicious implants. [...]

title: October Windows Server updates cause Hyper-V VM boot issues
description: According to customer reports, this month's Patch Tuesday updates are breaking virtual machines on Hyper-V hosts, causing them to no longer boot and display "failed to start" errors. [...]
